decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. By controlling the board and hand of the opponent, the deck aims to gain an advantage and win the game through efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker. The deck's mana base allows for flexibility in casting the many blue, green, and black spells in the deck, while also utilizing powerful land disruption in the form of Wasteland. Overall, the deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a long and grindy game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker to close out the game. Additionally, the deck also includes cards like Delver of Secrets and Vendilion Clique to provide additional versatility and card advantage. Through a mixture of proactive threats and reactive spells, this BUG Control deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast its opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize low-cost efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Nimble Mongoose to pressure the opponent's life total. The deck is packed with cheap disruption spells such as Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle to protect your threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card selection and card advantage tools like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Sylvan Library to ensure you are drawing the cards you need to maintain pressure and answer threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of disruption and powerful creatures like Dark Confidant, Deathrite Shaman, and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Swords to Plowshares, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also being able to generate card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. The inclusion of equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte adds additional value to the deck, allowing for versatile and powerful plays to maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on using control elements such as counterspells, removal, and hand disruption to slow down the opponent while building up resources with card advantage and powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. By efficiently managing threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, eventually taking control of the game with the powerful planeswalker Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls also provides a resilient threat that can help stabilize the board and apply pressure.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through efficient removal spells, counter spells, and powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Stoneforge Mystic. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes equipment cards like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to create threatening board presence. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats, this control - Stoneblade archetype seeks to outlast opponents and win the game through attrition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage to generate card advantage and outvalue opponents. The Stoneforge Mystic package provides access to powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further control the battlefield. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a suite of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also generating token pressure with Lingering Souls.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Goblins. By utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to put Goblins into play quickly, along with powerful tribal synergies like Goblin Warchief and Goblin Ringleader, the deck can quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. Additionally, cards like Gempalm Incinerator provide some removal options while cards like Siege-Gang Commander provide additional ways to close out the game. The deck focuses on speed and consistency to quickly overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with aggressive Merfolk creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan with counterspells and land destruction. By efficiently utilizing Aether Vial and lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, you can overwhelm your opponent with a constant stream of powerful creatures. Additionally, cards like Daze and Force of Will provide additional protection and disruption to keep your opponents off balance. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early and maintain control throughout the game.

The main concept of this Aggro-Jund deck is to apply early pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Punishing Fire, and generate card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. Additionally, the deck includes a small land recursion package with Life from the Loam to provide long-term value and resilience.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful cards like Abrupt Decay, Force of Will, and Hymn to Tourach. It uses a combination of creatures like Baleful Strix, Deathrite Shaman, and Tarmogoyf to establish board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Ancestral Vision and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to outvalue the opponent. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to utilize a mix of removal, disruption, and card advantage to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a game of attrition.

The deck revolves around quickly cheating out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield through spells like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also contains cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's plans. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with these high-impact threats before they can establish their own game plan, leading to a quick and dominant victory.

The main idea of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy. Once enough mana is generated, the player can use Tendrils of Agony to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in one turn, winning the game. The deck also includes cards like Ad Nauseam and Burning Wish to help find specific cards needed to execute the combo. Overall, the deck focuses on fast mana generation and comboing off quickly to win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana and draw through your deck in order to cast Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage. Using cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana, along with card draw spells like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe, allows the deck to find and cast its win condition in a single turn. By disrupting the opponent with cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress, the deck aims to combo off before the opponent can mount a defense. The inclusion of Past in Flames allows for extra recursion and redundancy in case the combo is disrupted.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast mana sources and efficient card draw spells to quickly build up a high storm count and then cast a powerful spell like Tendrils of Agony or Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to generate as much mana as possible in a single turn, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Silence to ensure a successful combo finish. The Burning Wish sideboard adds versatility by allowing access to a wide range of powerful spells to fit various situations.

The deck focuses on deploying cheap artifact creatures quickly and efficiently powered by mana sources like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum. These creatures benefit from support cards like Cranial Plating and Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas to become threats that can quickly deal massive amounts of damage. The synergy between the artifact creatures and support cards allows for a fast and aggressive playstyle, overwhelming opponents before they have a chance to react.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain control of the game by using cards like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to counter spells, along with Terminus and Swords to Plowshares for creature removal. Other key elements include Brainstorm for card selection, Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage, and Entreat the Angels for a finishing blow. The deck also runs cards like Back to Basics and Moat to lock down the opponent's mana and creatures, respectively. Additionally, Engineered Explosives and Detention Sphere provide versatile removal options.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's plans. It also utilizes the Counterbalance + Sensei's Divining Top combo to counter spells consistently. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and powerful abilities to dominate the game. The deck aims to control the board state and outvalue the opponent by efficiently countering threats and drawing into more answers. With a mix of control elements and card advantage, it strives to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a game of resource management.
